executionsHelp.inactive:
While building your workflow, click the 'execute step' button, then trigger an MQTT event. This will trigger an execution, which will show up in this editor.

Once you're happy with your workflow, activate it. Then every time a change is detected, the workflow will execute. These executions will show up in the executions list, but not in the editor.
executionsHelp.active:
While building your workflow, click the 'execute step' button, then trigger an MQTT event. This will trigger an execution, which will show up in this editor.

Your workflow will also execute automatically, since it's activated. Every time a change is detected, this node will trigger an execution. These executions will show up in the executions list, but not in the editor.

triggerPanel.activationHint: Once you’ve finished building your workflow, activate it to have it also listen continuously (you just won’t see those executions here).

properties.name: topics
properties.description: Topics to subscribe to, multiple can be defined with comma. Wildcard characters are supported (+ - for single level and # - for multi level). By default all subscription used QoS=0. To set a different QoS, write the QoS desired after the topic preceded by a colom. For Example: topicA:1,topicB:2

options.name: jsonParseBody
options.description: Whether to try parse the message to an object

options.name: onlyMessage
options.description: Whether to return only the message property

options.name: parallelProcessing
options.description: Whether to process messages in parallel or by keeping the message in order
